Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Hymenoptaecin (XXF; natural AMPs; insects, arthropods, invertebrates, animals; JJsn)

Literature Information.Literature: G: 19%.Chemical modification: A 2-pyrrolidone-5-carboxylic acid was found at the N-terminus.Activity: activity is not media-dependent. Inhibited B. bronchiseptica, H. influenzae, K. aerogenes, Y. enterocolitica, plant-assocaited E. salicis, R. melilot, X. campestris. Also M. lysodeikticus (MIC 1-5 uM). Active against G+ bacteria B. negaterium (MIC 0.5-1 uM), and G- bacteria  E. coli K514 (MIC 0.5-5 uM), X. campestris (MIC 0.5-1.0 uM), E. carotouoru ssp (MIC 1-5 uM), and A. tumefaciens (MIC 50 ug/ml).Synergy:AMPs: It shows synergistic effects with Abaecin against E. coli (Rahnamaeian et al., 2015). Updated 3/2017.
Literature Information.Author: Casteels P, Ampe C, Jacobs F, Tempst P.1993
Literature Information.Title: Functional and chemical characterization of Hymenoptaecin, an antibacterial polypeptide that is infection-inducible in the honeybee (Apis mellifera).
